en.plus:
A collection of 9 Risograph prints depicting the ski lifts of Verbier, Switzerland. This series is based on engineering drawings from the Téléverbier archives dating from 1961 to 1997. Each print pays tribute to these historical structures of the ski resort that played a significant role in establishing Verbier as a world-renowned winter destination. While some of these lifts have since been replaced, seasoned skiers in Verbier will likely recognize these iconic structures.

Set of 9 prints
Limited edition of 50 copies (numbered)
Format: 200 × 200 mm
Printing technique: Risograph

en.aboutwork:
Sam Bruchez is a Swiss-American graphic designer based in NYC.

Born and raised in the Swiss Alps, Sam combines his experiences in the outdoors with a keen eye for graphic design. He studied marketing at the University of Vermont and graphic design at écal (Lausanne).

Over the past ten years, Sam has had extensive experience designing for outdoors and fashion brands in Zürich and New York. Some of his previous clients include The North Face, Head and Supreme. Professional portfolio and CV are available upon request.

Recently, he’s been working with FUNDIS, a non-profit studying North American fungi. In his personal design work, Sam explores the archives of the Entremont district, the region where he grew up in Switzerland.
more on info at info www.echomemo.ch and on instagram @echo.memo.

Skills: graphic design for print and digital, Adobe, Wordpress HTML/CSS/JS

Email: sam@sambruchez.com
Instagram: @trickedbytrash
